column4: heh, i still am amazed by the number of unencrypted wireless networks. i use WPA-PSK here
cool- is it included in sid?
how do you find a package based on its contents in apt-cache?
i dont' think apt-cache can do what apt-file does. tell me how
i just checked the man page- there's nothing about finding a package based on a file it contains
apt-cache search will only look through filenames & descriptions.
well...you said there's no point to apt-file
when you're compiling a package and it neads libblah.so.1 and you don't know what package contains that file, you'll need apt-file
nope. This is why I love Apt :D
heh, yeah- but sometimes you might want to compile
do you know about apt-get build-dep?
it downloads build dependencies automatically for you
next time I crash my system I'm gonna do it that way :P
